section.name: Properties
section.p: Properties may be defined within a <library>, <processor>, <module>, <project>, or <resource> withing an enclosing <properties> element. Library properties serve as the most generic and are inherited by processor and module definitions. Modules, projects and resources inherit property setting from their enclosing module.
The <type> and <include> elements may also contain <property> declarations.

tr.td: The property value. Values may contain references to system properties and properties defined within the property set (locally or inherited) using the form ${[property-name]} - e.g. ${user.name}.

section.name: Example

p.i: Example property definition from the DPML root module.

section.source: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <properties> <property name="project.publisher.name" value="Digital Product Meta Library"/> <property name="project.specification.vendor" value="${project.publisher.name}"/> <property name="project.implementation.vendor" value="${project.publisher.name}"/> <property name="project.implementation.vendor-id" value="net.dpml"/> <property name="project.publisher.url" value="http://www.dpml.net"/> <property name="project.resource.host" value="http://repository.dpml.net"/> <property name="project.api.host" value="http://api.dpml.net"/> <property name="project.svn.host" value="svn://svn.berlios.de/dpml/trunk/main"/> </properties>

p.i: Example property definition within a project type directive.

section.source: <project name="dpml-composition-editor" basedir="composition/editor"> <types> <type id="jar"/> <type id="plugin"> <property name="project.plugin.class" value="net.dpml.composition.edit.CompositionEditorFactory"/> </type> </types> <dependencies> <include key="dpml-component-control" tag="public"/> <include ref="jgoodies/forms" tag="private"/> </dependencies> </project>
